body_html:
thanks for the explanation @tambu-j. I pip install protobuf and absl before doing the windows build. Also, I found, for GPU version build, cuda/bin and cudnn/bin needs to be in PATH, otherwise, will have errors like

File "C:/agent/work/5/b/tf_python/tensorflow/tools/api/generator/create_python_api.py", line 26, in

2018-05-11T02:49:37.9634660Z from tensorflow.python.util import tf_decorator
2018-05-11T02:49:37.9636047Z File "C:\agent_work\5\b\tf_python\tensorflow\python_init.py", line 49, in
2018-05-11T02:49:37.9636803Z from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
2018-05-11T02:49:37.9638401Z File "C:\agent_work\5\b\tf_python\tensorflow\python\pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 30, in
2018-05-11T02:49:37.9639141Z self_check.preload_check()
2018-05-11T02:49:37.9640148Z File "C:\agent_work\5\b\tf_python\tensorflow\python\platform\self_check.py", line 97, in preload_check
2018-05-11T02:49:37.9641098Z % (build_info.cudnn_dll_name, build_info.cudnn_version_number))
2018-05-11T02:49:37.9643318Z ImportError: Could not find 'cudnn64_7.dll'. TensorFlow requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. Note that installing cuDNN is a separate step from installing CUDA, and this DLL is often found in a different directory from the CUDA DLLs. You may install the necessary DLL by downloading cuDNN 7 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn

thanks for the explanation @tambu-j. I pip install protobuf and absl before doing the windows build. Also, I found, for GPU version build, cuda/bin and cudnn/bin needs to be in PATH, otherwise, will have errors like

File "C:/agent/work/5/b/tf_python/tensorflow/tools/api/generator/create_python_api.py", line 26, in

You may install the necessary DLL by downloading cuDNN 7 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn
body:
thanks for the explanation @tambu-j. I pip install protobuf and absl before doing the windows build. Also, I found, for GPU version build, cuda/bin and cudnn/bin needs to be in PATH, otherwise, will have errors like 

> File "C:/agent/_work/5/b/tf_python/tensorflow/tools/api/generator/create_python_api.py", line 26, in 
> <module>
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9634660Z              from tensorflow.python.util import tf_decorator
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9636047Z            File "C:\agent\_work\5\b\tf_python\tensorflow\python\__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9636803Z              from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9638401Z            File "C:\agent\_work\5\b\tf_python\tensorflow\python\pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 30, in <module>
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9639141Z              self_check.preload_check()
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9640148Z            File "C:\agent\_work\5\b\tf_python\tensorflow\python\platform\self_check.py", line 97, in preload_check
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9641098Z              % (build_info.cudnn_dll_name, build_info.cudnn_version_number))
> 2018-05-11T02:49:37.9643318Z          ImportError: Could not find 'cudnn64_7.dll'. TensorFlow requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. Note that installing cuDNN is a separate step from installing CUDA, and this DLL is often found in a different directory from the CUDA DLLs. You may install the necessary DLL by downloading cuDNN 7 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn
